definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: She is a smart, innocent, and lovely girl.
sentences.chinese: 她是个冰雪聪明的女孩，很招人喜欢。

sentences.english: She enable Wong Yung to be a clever and unruly, it's lively because of Barbara Yung.
sentences.chinese: 她，把黄蓉的冰雪聪明以及刁蛮任性的性格演得生动。

sentences.english: I am an ice snow smart girl.
sentences.chinese: 我是个冰雪聪明的女孩。

sentences.english: She had heard that the Countess was a very clever woman.
sentences.chinese: 她听说伯爵夫人冰雪聪明。

definition: a hint is all that is needed/understanding each other without the need to explain
to be good at understanding others (idiom)
open and candid (idiom); not hiding anything/ingenuous
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
